intro: Boerlagiodendron lineare, commonly known as the slender boerlagia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have four or five petals. The fruit is a capsule that dehisces to release small, dry seeds.
